title: Scoring & Alpha
text:
Variables/Measures used in following analyses: anx, HUM, auth, dep, PNIG, PNIV, PAT, COMP, SIM, EREGS, SPDS, PRAY, FORGO, GRAT, JOY, SSG, avd, DISC, dos, DSE, PURP, QST, SCON, SIM. Christian Nationalism, Burnout-Work, Burnout-Personal, Social justice, Forgiveness of self, Scripture, Attachment to God anxiety and attachment to God vulnerability.
Variables not yet scored: GRAT, DISC, DSE

title: Scoring & Alpha
text:
Distress

Anxiety


Show the code
    # Create a new dataframe
    selected_vars <- c(
      "anx4_1", "anx4_2", "anx4_3", "anx4_4", "anx4_5", "anx4_6", "anx4_7", 
      "anx5_1", "anx5_2", "anx5_3", "anx5_4", "anx5_5", "anx5_6", "anx5_7",
      "anx6_1", "anx6_2", "anx6_3", "anx6_4", "anx6_5", "anx6_6", "anx6_7")
    ecr_data <- subset(data, select = selected_vars)
    # Set up scoring rules
    keys <- make.keys(ecr_data, list(
      ANX4r=c("anx4_1", "anx4_2", "anx4_3", "anx4_4", "anx4_5", "anx4_6", "anx4_7"), 
      ANX5r=c("anx5_1", "anx5_2", "anx5_3", "anx5_4", "anx5_5", "anx5_6", "anx5_7"),
      ANX6r=c("anx6_1", "anx6_2", "anx6_3", "anx6_4", "anx6_5", "anx6_6", "anx6_7")))
    scores <- scoreItems(keys,ecr_data, totals = TRUE)
    # Add scored variabels into dataframe
    data$ANX4r <- scores[["scores"]][, "ANX4r"]
    data$ANX5r <- scores[["scores"]][, "ANX5r"]
    data$ANX6r <- scores[["scores"]][, "ANX6r"]
    # Alpha 
    scores$alpha


          ANX4r     ANX5r     ANX6r
alpha 0.8873101 0.8837769 0.8661696

title: Gender Differences
text:
0.3 Present Study
While gender differences have been examined across a host of disciplines, few have examined future religious leaders. Our current studies examine psychological, spiritual, and character differences in men and women.
Spiritual: Spiritual discipline, scripture, spiritual struggle, prayer, self-control, attachement to God anxiety, attachment to God vulnerability
Character: Forgiveness of others, forgiveness of self, compassion, humility
Personality: Narcissism Vulnerability, Narcissism Grandiosity, Authoritarian, Christian nationalism
Psychological: Emotional suppression, differentiatin of self, avoidance
Distress: Burnout-Work, Burnout-personal, anxiety symptoms,






Note



I know that this is probably too many variables but all of them are so interesting I’m including them for now.

title: Spiritual Formation Assessment
text:
This is the central webpage which will house all analyses pertaining to the Spiritual Formation Assessment study led by Dr. David Wang at Fuller Theological Seminary.
You will also find information pertaining to psychometrics (such as internal reliability) here.
Analyses and present website are managed by Seungju Kim (seungju.kim@my.wheaton.edu), in case you have any questions.
Note: Dark mode is available on top right toggle.

title: Predictors of Christian Nationalism
text:
Update:
12/23/23

title: Predictors of Christian Nationalism
text:
0.1 Present Study
Given the unique position seminary students are in, we recognize the need to identify narcissism and its predictors.
The present study will examine rates of narcissism (grandiosity and vulnerability) in seminary students, and identify predictors which may help community stakeholders and clinicians make informed decisions on care and leadership appointment.






Note



The rationale above is not final, and may need revision.


We will be examining three broad categories and specific measures proposed below:
Character: Humility, Self-control, forgiveness.
Mental Distress: Depression, Anxiety, Shame.
Spirituality: Prayer, spiritual struggle, Spiritual discipline.






Note



Worth noting that sample size for T4-T6 is 365 while sample size for T5-T6 is 452. Given this substantial difference in sample size, we will conduct analyses with T5-T6.




Show the code

  mutate(sexori6 = case_when(
    sexori6_2 == 1 | sexori6_3 == 1 | sexori6_other == 1 ~ "Lesbian/Gay/Bisexual",
    sexori6_1 == 1 ~ "Straight/Heterosexual",
    TRUE ~ NA_character_
  ))

  mutate(rac6_col = case_when(

title: Predictors of Christian Nationalism
text:
2.1 Preliminary Analyses


Show the code
# data <- data %>%

2.2 Temporal Variables


Show the code
# Narcissism
data$PNIGt <- (data$PNIG6r - data$PNIG5r)
data$PNIVt <- (data$PNIV6r - data$PNIV5r)

# Character
data$HUMt <- (data$HUM6r - data$HUM5r)
data$FORGSt <- (data$FORGS6r - data$FORGS5r)
data$FORGOt <- (data$FORGO6r - data$FORGO5r)
data$COMPt <- (data$COMP6r - data$COMP5r)

# Spirituality
data$SSGt <- (data$SSG6r - data$SSG5r)
data$SPDSt <- (data$SPDS6r - data$SPDS5r)
data$SCRIt <- (data$SCRI6r - data$SCRI5r)
data$PRAYt <- (data$PRAY6r - data$PRAY5r)

# Outcome Variable
data$CNATt <- (data$CNAT6r - data$CNAT5r)

# Social Values
data$SJCt <- (data$SJC6r - data$SJC5r)
data$ICt <- (data$IC6r - data$IC5r)

data$SIMt <- (data$SIM6r - data$SIM5r)


Before running multiple regression, test for multicollinearity.

bys_data <- subset(data, select = selected_vars)
# Correlation
bys_table <- apa.cor.table(bys_data, 
                        table.number=1)
apa.save(filename = "cor_table.doc",

title: Predictors of Christian Nationalism
text:
